parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Minimum brightness level
parameter.description: The parameter is set automatically during the calibration process. The parameter can be changed manually after the calibration.

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Maximum brightness level
parameter.description: The parameter is set automatically during the calibration process. The parameter can be changed manually after the calibration.

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Incandescence level of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps
parameter.description: Virtual value set as a percentage level between parameters MIN (1%) and MAX. (99%). The Dimmer will set to this value after first switch on. It is required for warming up and switching dimmable compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources.

parameter.name: config_4_2
parameter.label: 4: Incandescence time of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps
parameter.description: This parameter determines the time required for switching compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources. Setting this parameter to 0 will disable the incandescence functionality. Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 25,5s)

parameter.name: config_5_1
parameter.label: 5: Dimming Step at Automatic Control
parameter.description: The parameter defines the percentage of a dimming step at automatic control. 1-99

parameter.name: config_6_2
parameter.label: 6: Dimming Step Timing at Automatic Control
parameter.description: The parameter defines the time of a dimming step at automatic control. Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 2,55s)

parameter.name: config_7_1
parameter.label: 7: Dimming Step at Manual Control
parameter.description: The parameter defines the percentage of a dimming step at manual control. 1-99

parameter.name: config_8_2
parameter.label: 8: Dimming Step Timing at Manual Control
parameter.description: The parameter defines the time of a dimming step at manual control. Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 2,55s)

parameter.name: config_9_1
parameter.label: 9: Saving state before power failure
parameter.description: Saving state before power failure

options.option: State NOT saved at power failure, all outputs are set to OFF upon powe
State saved at power failure, all outputs are set to previous state up

parameter.name: config_10_2
parameter.label: 10: Timer functionality (auto - off). 0 disables the function
parameter.description: The parameter defines the setting of the timer. Available settings:1-32767 - time to turn off measured in seconds (1s - 9,1h)

parameter.name: config_11_2
parameter.label: 11: ALL ON/ALL OFF function
parameter.description: The parameter specifies the available functions.

options.option: ALL ON not active, ALL OFF not active
ALL ON not active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON active, ALL OFF not active
ALL ON active, ALL OFF active

parameter.name: config_13_1
parameter.label: 13: Force auto-calibration
parameter.description: Changing the value of this parameter to 1 will force the calibration process. During the calibration parameter is set to 1 and switched to 0 upon completion.

options.option: force auto-calibration of the load without Fibaro Bypass
force auto-calibration of the load with Fibaro Bypass

parameter.name: config_14_1
parameter.label: 14: Auto-calibration status (read-only parameter)
parameter.description: This parameter determines operating mode of the Dimmer (automatic/manual settings).

options.option: calibration procedure not performed or Dimmer operates on manual setti

parameter.name: config_15_1
parameter.label: 15: Burnt out bulb detection
parameter.description: percentage value of power variation, compared to standard power consumption, measured during the calibration procedure (to be interpreted as load error/burnt out bulb). 1-99, 0 disables the function.

parameter.name: config_16_2
parameter.label: 16: Time delay of a burnt out bulb (parameter 15) or overload (parameter 39) detection
parameter.description: Time of delay (in seconds) for power variation detection, interpreted as a LOAD ERROR or OVERLOAD detection (too much power connected to the Dimmer 2). 0 disables the function.

parameter.name: config_19_1
parameter.label: 19: Forced switch on brightness level
parameter.description: If the parameter is active, switching on the Dimmer 2 (S1 single click) will always set this brightness level. 0 disables the function.

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: Inputs Button/Switch configuration
parameter.description: Binary inputs type configuration

parameter.name: config_21_1
parameter.label: 21: Value sent to associated devices on single click
parameter.description: The value sent to associated devices on single click.

options.option: 0xFF value is sent, which will set associated devices to their last sa
current Dimmer 2 state is sent, which will synchronize brightness leve

parameter.name: config_22_1
parameter.label: 22: Change [On-Off] bi-stable keys
parameter.description: This function allow user to change [On-Off] bi-stable keys (parameter no. 14) (default value 0)

options.option: Device changes status on key status change
Device status depends on key status; ON when the key is ON, OFF when t

parameter.name: config_23_1
parameter.label: 23: Double click option
parameter.description: Double-click set lighting at 100%

parameter.name: config_24_1
parameter.label: 24: Command frames sent in 2nd and 3rd association groups (S1 associations)
parameter.description: Parameter determines, which actions will not result in sending frames to association groups.

options.option: all actions send to association groups
do not send when switching ON (single click)
do not send when switching OFF (single click)
do not send when changing dimming level (holding and releasing)
do not send on double click

parameter.name: config_25_1
parameter.label: 25: Command frames sent in 4th and 5th association groups (S2associations)
parameter.description: Parameter determines, which actions will not result in sending frames to association groups.

options.option: all actions send to association groups
do not send when switching ON (single click)
do not send when switching OFF (single click)
do not send when changing dimming level (holding and releasing)
do not send on double click

parameter.name: config_26_1
parameter.label: 26: The function of 3-way switch
parameter.description: Key no. 2 controls the Dimmer additionally (in 3-way switch mode). Function disabled for parameter 20 set to 2 (roller blind switch).

parameter.name: config_27_1
parameter.label: 27: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
parameter.description: This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. It does not apply to 1st Lifeline group.

parameter.name: config_28_1
parameter.label: 28: Scene activation functionality
parameter.description: SCENE ID depends on the switch type configuration

parameter.name: config_29_1
parameter.label: 29: Switch functionality of S1 and S2
parameter.description: Switch S1 and S2 buttons

options.option: S1 operates as S2, S2 operates as S1

parameter.name: config_30_1
parameter.label: 30: Load control mode
parameter.description: The parameter defines the used control mode.

options.option: control mode selected automatically (based on auto-calibration)

parameter.name: config_31_1
parameter.label: 31: Load control mode recognized during auto-calibration
parameter.description: Load control mode recognized during auto-calibration

parameter.name: config_32_1
parameter.label: 32: On/Off mode
parameter.description: This mode is necessary while connecting non-dimmable light sources. Enabling parameter 32 automatically ignores brightening/- dimming time settings.

options.option: on/off mode enabled (dimming is not possible)

parameter.name: config_33_1
parameter.label: 33: Dimmability of the load (read only)
parameter.description: Dimmability of the load (read only)

parameter.name: config_34_1
parameter.label: 34: Soft-Start functionality
parameter.description: Time required to warm up the filament of halogen bulb.

parameter.name: config_35_1
parameter.label: 35: Auto-calibration after power on
parameter.description: This parameter determines the trigger of auto-calibration procedure, e.g. power on, load error, etc.

options.option: No auto-calibration of the load after power on
Auto-calibration performed after first power on
Auto-calibration performed after each power on
Auto-calibration performed after first power on or after each LOAD ERR
Auto-calibration performed after each power on or after each LOAD ERRO

parameter.name: config_37_1
parameter.label: 37: Behaviour of the Dimmer after overload or surge

options.option: device permanently disabled until re-enabling by comand or push-button
three attempts to turn on the load

parameter.name: config_39_2
parameter.label: 39: Power limit - OVERLOAD
parameter.description: Reaching the defined value will result in turning off the load. Parameter 39 is relevant only in a 3-wire connection i or a 2-wire connection for load of cosφ ≥ 0.99. (1 W - 250 W). 0 disables the function.

parameter.name: config_40_1
parameter.label: 40: General Purpose Alarm
parameter.description: The parameter specifies the response to an alarm.

parameter.name: config_41_1
parameter.label: 41: Water Flooding Alarm
parameter.description: The parameter specifies the response to an alarm.

parameter.name: config_42_1
parameter.label: 42: Smoke, CO or CO2 Alarm
parameter.description: The parameter specifies the response to an alarm.

parameter.name: config_43_1
parameter.label: 43: Temperature Alarm
parameter.description: The parameter specifies the response to an alarm.

parameter.name: config_44_2
parameter.label: 44: Time of alarm state
parameter.description: Alarm state may be cancelled earlier, as a result of pushing the wall-switch keys or sending the Z-Wave command frame. Available settings: 1-32767 (1s - 32767s).

parameter.name: config_45_1
parameter.label: 45: OVERLOAD alarm report
parameter.description: (load power consumption too high)

parameter.name: config_46_1
parameter.label: 46: LOAD ERROR alarm report
parameter.description: (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb)

parameter.name: config_47_1
parameter.label: 47: OVERCURRENT alarm report
parameter.description: (short circuit, burnt out bulb causing overcurrent)

parameter.name: config_48_1
parameter.label: 48: SURGE alarm report
parameter.description: (Dimmer output overvoltage)

parameter.name: config_49_1
parameter.label: 49: OVERHEAT (critical temperature) and VOLTAGE DROP (low voltage) alarm report

parameter.name: config_50_1
parameter.label: 50: Active power reports
parameter.description: The parameter defines the power level change that will result in a new power report being sent. The value is a percentage of the previous report. 0 disables the function.

parameter.name: config_52_2
parameter.label: 52: Periodic active power and energy reports
parameter.description: Parameter 52 defines a time period between consecutive reports. Timer is reset and counted from zero after each report (1 sec - 32767 sec). 0 disables the function.

parameter.name: config_53_2
parameter.label: 53: Energy reports
parameter.description: Energy level change which will result in sending a new energy report. Available settings: 1-255 (0,01 - 2,55 kWh). 0 disables the function.

parameter.name: config_54_1
parameter.label: 54: Self-measurement
parameter.description: The Dimmer may include active power and energy used by itself in reports sent to the main controller.

parameter.name: config_58_1
parameter.label: 58: Method of calculating the active power
parameter.description: This parameter defines how to calculate active power. It is useful in a case of 2-wire connection with light sources other than resistive. Note: Parameter 58 is set to 0 after forced auto-calibration

options.option: measurement based on the standard algorithm
approximation based on the calibration data
approximation based on the control angle

parameter.name: config_59_2
parameter.label: 59: Approximated power at the maximum brightness level
parameter.description: This parameter determines the approximate value of the power that will be reported by the device at its maximum brightness level. Available settings: 0-500 (0-500W). Note: Parameter 59 works only when parameter 58 has a value other than 0.
